solution_line_template: Jennifer's home is {first_museum_distance} miles away from the first museum, so the round trip back and forth is {first_museum_distance} miles there + {first_museum_distance} miles back = <<{first_museum_distance}+{first_museum_distance}={round_trip_first}>>{round_trip_first} miles altogether.

On another day Jennifer goes to a museum {second_museum_distance} miles away + {second_museum_distance} miles to return home = <<{second_museum_distance}+{second_museum_distance}={round_trip_second}>>{round_trip_second} miles total.

Combined, Jennifer travels {round_trip_first} miles on the first day + {round_trip_second} miles on the second day = <<{round_trip_first}+{round_trip_second}={total_miles}>>{total_miles} miles Jennifer travels total.
